creator: jjb@bcc.com
text:
I was having trouble getting mod_php to run.  When I loaded it *before* loading
mod_perl, it started working.

This was in httpd.conf:

# mod_perl
PerlModule Apache2
LoadModule perl_module modules/mod_perl.so

# mod_php
LoadModule php4_module modules/libphp4.so
AddType application/x-httpd-php .php
AddType application/x-httpd-php-source .phps


The banner from error_log:

[Fri Dec 27 03:11:09 2002] [notice] Apache/2.0.43 (Unix) mod_perl/1.99_07-dev
Perl/v5.8.0 DAV/2 mod_ssl/2.0.43 OpenSSL/0.9.6h configured -- resuming normal
operations

(note php is missing)


I changed httpd.conf to read:

# mod_php
LoadModule php4_module modules/libphp4.so
AddType application/x-httpd-php .php
AddType application/x-httpd-php-source .phps

# mod_perl
PerlModule Apache2
LoadModule perl_module modules/mod_perl.so


The banner from error_log now shows PHP:

[Fri Dec 27 03:12:58 2002] [notice] Apache/2.0.43 (Unix) mod_perl/1.99_07-dev
Perl/v5.8.0 mod_ssl/2.0.43 OpenSSL/0.9.6h PHP/4.3.0 DAV/2 configured -- resuming
normal operations

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This has nothing to do with the httpd-2.0 server.

  The mod_perl and the server were no longer cooperatively sharing the
  LoadModule directive.  You need the latest (1.99_07 or later) mod_perl
  which uses LoadPerlModule rather than overloading LoadModule to bring
  in perl based Apache modules.
